Bradley Cooper, born on December 5, 1975, in Cherry Hill, New Jersey, is an American actor, producer, and director, known for his dynamic performances in both film and television. Raised in a close-knit family, Cooper initially aspired to be a stand-up comedian before discovering his passion for acting in college. He studied at the State University of New York at Purchase and later transferred to NYU's Tisch School of the Arts, where he graduated in 1997.
